'''Abby Anderson''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]], who was brought in after the family van crashed into an ambulance.



While on their way to a camping trip, Abby's family was in a car accident. She was impaled in the eye by a shard of glass and was unconscious in the field.

She was taken to the hospital, where her injuries were assessed. She was then taken into surgery. They initially thought she might lose her eye, but they developed a plan that allowed her to keep it. The shard of glass was removed and her eye and other injuries were repaired.



She was on a camping trip with her family when they were in a car accident. Her father, mother, and grandmother all died of their injuries, but she, [[Michael Anderson|her brother]], and [[Lily Anderson|her sister]] all survived.


*She was  at the time of her parents' deaths.
*She was excited about the camping trip.

'''Annette Aranda''' is the wife of [[Raul Aranda]].


Annette came to the hospital with her husband, who was coughing up blood. After a bronchoscopy found a tree growing in his lung, he had surgery to remove it and was just fine.



She is married to [[Raul Aranda]].


Her father or father-in-law died of cancer, which she and her son were worried would also happen to Raul.

|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Caroline Macey]]
}}
'''Dana''' gave birth via emergency c-section at Bentley Hospital.



Dana's baby was delivered via emergency C-section despite Bentley Hospital not having the proper facilities. Her baby was then transported to [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]], because she had a tracheoesophageal fistula, which was causing her to have trouble breathing. When [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] and [[Alex Karev|Alex]] came to get the baby, Dana tried to go with them, saying her baby didn't even have a name yet. Meredith reassured her, saying that they were taking her daughter to [[Arizona Robbins|the best baby surgeon there is]] and she would come to Seattle to see her baby and then she could name her. ''("[[Dark Was the Night]]")''


Once at the hospital, Dana's daughter was taken into surgery to repair the fistula. The surgery was successful. ''("[[Suddenly]]")''



She has a daughter, delivered via emergency c-section at Bentley Hospital.

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Dana}}

'''Doris Samuels''' is the wife of [[Mr. Samuels]], a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


After Mr. Samuels had surgery, Doris came to the hospital, saying she'd been out of town when she got the news. When Stephanie started to tell her what happened, Doris figured it out. She already knew that he wanted to do it. She said he likes a little pain with his pleasure. Stinging arouses him. She doesn't understand it, but she loves him, so she accepts it.



Doris is married to [[Mr. Samuels]] and loves her husband despite his unusual sexual appetite because she says it's just one of a million things to know about him and the rest are so much more interesting.

'''Grandma Anderson''' was in a car accident which killed her, her son, and her daughter-in-law.



She came along with her son and his family on a camping trip. However, on their way there, they were in a car accident. She died on the scene of a head injury. Her son and his wife later died at the hospital, leaving her newly -year-old granddaughter, [[Lily Anderson|Lily]], as the oldest surviving member of their family.



She and her son's family were close. They were planning to go camping together, but on the way, they were in a car accident, which ultimately killed her, her son, and her son's wife. Her three grandchildren were injured, but survived the accident.

'''Jessica Anderson''' was on her way to a  camping trip with her family when they were in a car accident.


During the accident, Jessica was thrown from the car. Her daughter, Lily, attempted to rouse her, but she didn't wake up at the scene. She was tended to at the scene by Meredith before being taken to the ER.

The ER staff attempted to resuscitate her, but they were unsuccessful and she died.



She was married to [[Robert Anderson]]. Together, they had three kids, Lily, Michael, and Abby.


She was on a camping trip with her husband, mother-in-law, and three children when they were in a car accident. She, her husband, and her mother-in-law all died in the accident, leaving the three kids, including newly  year old [[Lily Anderson|Lily]], on their own.


*She was pronounced dead at : AM.

'''Lily Anderson''' was in a car accident with her family that killed her grandmother and both her parents.


Lily was awake and only had minor injuries after the car accident. She went to Meredith and begged her to help her family after she was unable to wake her mother. When Meredith instructed her to hold [[Dana (Dark Was the Night)|Dana's]] baby, she said she doesn't even babysit, but Meredith told her it was the only way she could help her family. Lily took the baby and manually ventilated her while Meredith went to her mother.

The whole family was taken to the emergency room, where Lily was given an ice pack but was otherwise okay.

When [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] informed her that her father's organs were shutting down and they hadn't been able to take him off life support, she signed the papers to withdraw care and sat with him while he died.



Lily was resentful of being made to go on the camping trip, as she wanted to spend her birthday with her friends. When Meredith explained what was happening with her father, she made the difficult choice to withdraw care and allow him to die. She then told her siblings that their parents had died along with their grandmother.


*Her parents both died on her th birthday.

{{Nurse Infobox |image = xBronchoscopyNurse.png |name = Liz McKee |status = Alive |alias = Cheeky |parents = Parents |job = Nurse |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] |first appearance = [[Shiny Happy People]] |last appearance = [[I Bet It Stung]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Denice Sealy]] }} '''Liz McKee''' is a nurse at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. Ben flirted with her in order to get her not to schedule him on Tuesdays so he could play golf. ''("[[Shiny Happy People]]")'' When [[Henry Burton]] collapsed while jogging, Liz told Teddy about it, without knowing that Henry was her husband. ''("[[This is How We Do It]]")'' When [[Raul Aranda]] came into the ER coughing up blood, Liz was the nurse who helped with his bronchoscopy, where they found a tree growing in his lung. ''("[[I Will Survive]]")'' After a sinkhole opened up in the middle of the road, Liz informed April when three more patients were coming in. ''("[[Free Falling]]")'' When admin called and it sounded important, Liz notified Owen, who had recently been named the new Chief. ''("[[What is It About Men]]")'' When [[Robert Anderson]] coded in his room, Liz tried to remove his daughter, [[Lily Anderson|Lily]]. ''("[[Suddenly]]")'' When Cristina received a gift backset from a hospital that was trying to woo her, Teddy looked at the card and Liz told her it wasn't her basket so she shouldn't be looking at it. ''("[[The Girl with No Name]]")'' When [[Paul Dawson]] went into cardiac arrest in his room, Liz jumped in to start resuscitation. ''("[[Can't Fight This Feeling]]")'' When [[Mr. Samuels]] was injured after sticking his penis into a hornets nest, Liz was one of his nurses. Despite his wife's insistence that there was more to him than just that, Liz didn't believe that was possible. ''("[[I Bet It Stung]]")'' [[Ben Warren]] stated that she is mean. [[Ben Warren]] Ben Warren flirted with her in order to get her not to schedule him on Tuesdays because that's when he plays golf. As part of flirting with her, he gave her the nickname Cheeky. Her parents couldn't agree on a middle name when she was born, so she doesn't have one. She is a nurse at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. *Liz was credited as Pretty Nurse, E.R. Nurse, Bronchoscopy Nurse, Nurse, Nurse # and Desk Nurse. xPrettyNurse.png|[[Shiny Happy People]] xERNurse.png|[[This is How We Do It]] xBronchoscopyNurse.png|[[I Will Survive]] ERNurse.png|[[Free Falling]] Nurse.png|[[What is It About Men]] Nurse.png|[[Suddenly]] DeskNurse.png|[[The Girl with No Name]] xNurse.png|[[Can't Fight This Feeling]] xLizMcKee.png|[[I Bet It Stung]] {{Liz McKee Appearances}} {{DEFAULTSORT:McKee, Liz}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Nurses]]

'''Michael Anderson''' was in a car accident with his family that killed his grandmother and both parents.


While on their way to a camping trip, Michael's family was in a car accident. He was left pinned under a door, conscious but unable to move. He was extracted and taken to the emergency room at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].

In the ER, Michael had abdominal pain. His abdomen was rigid and they suspected a liver laceration. When a [[Computed Tomography|CT]] confirmed it, he was taken into surgery. While he was in surgery, he became unstable and was feverish. [[Ben Warren]] quickly diagnosed malignant hyperthermia. They iced Michael's body and turned the temperature in the room down and waited for his heart rate to go back down so they could finish his surgery.

His surgery was completed successfully and post-op, he was awake and alert.



Michael was on a camping trip with his family when they were in a car accident. His parents and his grandmother died, leaving him and his two sisters, [[Lily Anderson|Lily]] and [[Abby Anderson|Abby]], on their own.


*He was  at the time of his parents' deaths.

'''Mr. Samuels''' was a patient at\ua[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]\uawho came to the ER with hornet stings on his penis.


He initially told Stephanie that he took his pants off to make lunch outside. He made a peanut butter and honey sandwich. And then he fell asleep. When he woke up, he said the bees must have caught the scent of the honey that dripped onto his groin area. However, it was later revealed that he stuck his penis into the hornets' nest as a means of sexual pleasure.


When he came into the ER, he said that he hadn't been able to urinate since the previous day. Stephanie examined him and noticed that his penis was swollen. He told her it was due to a bug bite. When she questioned it, he said it was more of a bee sting. When she was still curious, he amended that it was multiple bee stings. He told her a story about how it happened that was later revealed to be false. She ordered IV Benadryl, a steroid, and a catheter so he could urinate and relieve pressure on his bladder.

When she went to catheterize Mr. Samuels, Stephanie was unable to find access, so she consulted with [[Catherine Fox|Catherine Avery]]. When Stephanie relayed his version of the events to Catherine Avery, she didn't buy it, immediately asking Mr. Samuels if he stuck his penis into the hornets' nest. He confirmed that he did and Catherine informed Stephanie that there's no access for a catheter and she needs to go directly into the bladder. She hopes they aren't too late. When Stephanie asks what happens if they're too late, Mr. Samuels notes that he doesn't feel like he has to pee anymore. Catherine says that's because his bladder has burst. Mr. Samuels starts screaming in agony and they take him to surgery. The surgery was successful, but he still needed skin grafts to repair the external damage.



He is married to [[Doris Samuels]], who loves him despite his unusual sexual appetite, stating that there are so many more interesting things to know about him.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Samuels, Mr.}}

'''Raul Aranda''' is a patient who was coughing up blood and was found to have a fir tree growing in his lung.


Raul came into the ER coughing up blood. While interviewing for Chief Resident with Owen, April went over the checklist she'd developed and said that Raul was headed for bronchoscopy to rule out cancer. His family overheard and was worried bout him having cancer. She assured them that that was a small chance. Cristina took over the case and took him into bronchoscopy, where she found out that he had a tree growing in his lung. She wanted to take him into surgery to remove it. However, because she'd broken protocol by doing the bronchoscopy without Teddy's authorization, the Arandas were offered another surgeon. However, they wanted to stick with Cristina, who had found the tree because he'd seen three doctors before for the cough and she finally gave him the right diagnosis.



He is married to [[Annette Aranda]].


His son, Miguel, was worried about him. Miguel's grandfather had had cancer and died from it.


{{DEFAULTSORT:Aranda, Raul}}

'''Robert Anderson''' was in a car accident with his mother, wife, and three children.



On their way to go camping, their family's van hit an ambulance that was pulled over on the side of the road. ''("[[Dark Was the Night]]")''

When Meredith and Alex began to tend to the family, he was conscious and alerted them that there was another kid unaccounted for. Alex continued to work on Robert while Meredith went in search of Michael.

He was taken to the ER, where Callie determined that his pelvis was crushed. He was then taken into surgery. He survived the surgery, but afterward, he kept coding. When his daughter was informed that he was taking longer to get back each time and his organs were starting to fail, she signed the papers allowing them to withdraw care and she sat with him while he died. ''("[[Suddenly]]")''



He was married to [[Jessica Anderson]]. They had three children together.


He and his family were taking a camping trip together when they were in an accident. He, his wife, and his mother died of their injuries, but his three children, despite being injured, were expected to make full recoveries. He felt guilty about making his family come, particularly Lily, who wanted to spend her birthday with friends.
